availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Bull (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, doctor.)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, doctor. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann Bachelor Bull. Father to John Bull, Lucy Bull, Edward Bull, Ellen Bull and Robert Bull. Sarsaparilla salesman in Louisville, Kentucky in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1850. Doctor in Louisville, Jefferson County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 2, p. 182A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 2, p. 799.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 3, p. 725.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, p. 264B.
"John Bull (1812-26 Apr 1875)," Find A Grave, Memorial 45606529, accessed May 9, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/45606529.
